verses.verse: I said<WH559> in my heart<WH3820>, Go to now<WH3212>, I will prove<WH5254> you with mirth<WH8057>, therefore enjoy<WH7200> pleasure<WH2896>: and<WH1892>, behold, this also is vanity.
I said<WH559> of laughter<WH7814>, It is mad<WH1984>: and of mirth<WH8057>, What<WH2090> does it<WH6213>?

I sought<WH8446> in my heart<WH3820> to give<WH4900> myself<WH1320> unto wine<WH3196>, yet acquainting<WH5090> my heart<WH3820> with wisdom<WH2451>; and to lay hold<WH270> on wickedness<WH5531>, until I might see<WH7200> what was that good<WH2896> for the sons<WH1121> of men<WH120>, which they should do<WH6213> under the heaven<WH8064> all<WH4557> the days<WH3117> of their life<WH2416>.
I made for me great<WH1431> works<WH4639>; I built<WH1129> houses<WH1004>; I planted<WH5193> vineyards<WH3754>:
I made<WH6213> for me gardens<WH1593> and orchards<WH6508>, and I planted<WH5193> trees<WH6086> in them of all kind of fruits<WH6529>:
I made<WH6213> for me pools<WH1295> of water<WH4325>, to water<WH8248> with it the wood<WH3293> that brings forth<WH6779> trees<WH6086>:

I got<WH7069> for me servants<WH5650> and maidens<WH8198>, and had servants born<WH1121> in my house<WH1004>; also I had great<WH7235> possessions<WH4735> of great<WH1241> and small cattle<WH6629> above all that were in Jerusalem<WH3389> before me<WH6440>:

I gathered<WH3664> for me also silver<WH3701> and gold<WH2091>, and the peculiar treasure<WH5459> of kings<WH4428> and of the provinces<WH4082>: I got<WH6213> me men singers<WH7891> and women singers<WH7891>, and the delights<WH8588> of the sons<WH1121> of men<WH120>, as musical instruments<WH7705>, and that of all sorts.
So I was great<WH1431>, and increased<WH3254> more than all that were before<WH6440> me in Jerusalem<WH3389>: also my wisdom<WH2451> remained with me<WH5975>.

And whatever my eyes<WH5869> desired<WH7592> I kept<WH680> not from them<WH4513>, I withheld not my heart<WH3820> from any joy<WH8057>; for my heart<WH3820> rejoiced<WH8056> in all my labor<WH5999>: and this was my portion<WH2506> of all my labor<WH5999>.

Then I looked<WH6437> on all the works<WH4639> that my hands<WH3027> had done<WH6213>, and on the labor<WH5999> that I had labored<WH5998> to do<WH6213>: and<WH1892>, behold, all was vanity and vexation<WH7469> of spirit<WH7307>, and there was no profit<WH3504> under the sun<WH8121>.

And I turned<WH6437> myself to behold<WH7200> wisdom<WH2451>, and madness<WH1947>, and wickedness<WH5531>: for what can the man<WH120> do that comes<WH935> after<WH310> the king<WH4428>? even that which has been already<WH3528> done<WH6213>.
Then I saw<WH7200> that<WH3426> wisdom<WH2451> excels<WH3504> wickedness<WH5531>, as far as light<WH216> excels<WH3504> darkness<WH2822>.

The wise man<WH2450>'s eyes<WH5869> are in his head<WH7218>; but the fool<WH3684> walks<WH1980> in darkness<WH2822>: and I myself perceived<WH3045> also that one<WH259> event<WH4745> happens to them all<WH7136>.

Then<WH227> said<WH559> I in my heart<WH3820>, As it happens<WH4745> to the fool<WH3684>, so it happens<WH7136> even to me<WH1571>; and why was I then more<WH3148> wise<WH2449>? Then I said<WH1696> in my heart<WH3820>, that this also is vanity<WH1892>.

For there is no memory<WH2146> of the wise<WH2450> more than<WH5973> of the fool<WH3684> for ever<WH5769>; seeing that which now<WH3528> is in the days<WH3117> to come<WH935> shall all be forgotten<WH7911>. And how dies<WH4191> the wise<WH2450> man<WH3684>? as the fool.

Therefore I hated<WH8130> life<WH2416>; because the work<WH4639> that is done<WH6213> under the sun<WH8121> is grievous<WH7451> unto me<WH1892>: for all is vanity and vexation<WH7469> of spirit<WH7307>.
Yes<WH8130>, I hated all my labor<WH5999> which I had taken<WH6001> under the sun<WH8121>: because I should leave<WH3240> it unto the man<WH120> that shall be after me<WH310>.

And who knows<WH3045> whether he shall be a wise<WH2450> man or a fool<WH5530>? yet shall he have rule<WH7980> over all my labor<WH5999> where I have labored<WH5998>, and where I have showed myself wise<WH2449> under the sun<WH8121>. This is also vanity<WH1892>.
Therefore I went about<WH5437> to cause<WH2976> my heart<WH3820> to despair<WH2976> of all the labor<WH5999> which I took<WH5998> under the sun<WH8121>.

For there is<WH3426> a man<WH120> whose labor<WH5999> is in wisdom<WH2451>, and in knowledge<WH1847>, and in equity<WH3788>; yet to a man<WH120> that has not labored<WH5998> in it shall he leave<WH5414> it for his portion<WH2506>. This also is vanity<WH1892> and a great<WH7227> evil<WH7451>.
For what has<WH1933> man<WH120> of all his labor<WH5999>, and of the vexation<WH7475> of his heart<WH3820>, where<WH1931> he has labored<WH6001> under the sun<WH8121>?
For all his days<WH3117> are sorrows<WH4341>, and his hardship<WH6045> grief<WH3708>; Yes<WH3820>, his heart takes not rest<WH7901> in the night<WH3915>. This is also vanity<WH1892>.

There is nothing better<WH2896> for a man<WH120>, than that he should eat<WH398> and drink<WH8354>, and that he should make his soul<WH5315> enjoy<WH7200> good<WH2896> in his labor<WH5999>. This<WH2090> also I saw<WH7200>, that it was from the hand<WH3027> of God<WH430>.
For who can eat<WH398>, or who else can hasten<WH2363> hereunto<WH2351>, more than I?

For God gives<WH5414> to a man<WH120> that is good<WH2896> in his sight<WH6440> wisdom<WH2451>, and knowledge<WH1847>, and joy<WH8057>: but to the sinner<WH2398> he gives<WH5414> hardship<WH6045>, to gather<WH622> and to heap up<WH3664>, that he may give<WH5414> to him that is good<WH2896> before<WH6440> God<WH430>. This also is vanity<WH1892> and vexation<WH7469> of spirit<WH7307>.
